layer.name: Skill
layer.definition: Get measurably better at what matters.

questions.text: My skill in honest self-examination is ...

answers.4: good — I have a method that surfaces what needs to surface
answers.5: sharp — I can search my heart honestly and thoroughly
answers.2: basic — I try but often miss or deceive myself
answers.3: developing — I catch some things, miss others
answers.1: absent — I don't know how to examine myself effectively

questions.text: My ability to identify the root of a sin pattern is ...
questions.principle: Root cause analysis is a skill

answers.4: good — I can usually diagnose what's really going on
answers.5: sharp — I've developed real diagnostic skill for spiritual issues
answers.2: basic — I know there's something deeper but can't find it
answers.3: developing — I sometimes trace to roots, sometimes stay at surface

questions.text: My ability to recover quickly after spiritual failure is ...

answers.4: good — I have a restoration process that works
answers.5: refined — I know how to repent, receive grace, and move on quickly
answers.2: slow — recovery takes a long time and lots of energy
answers.3: inconsistent — sometimes I bounce back, sometimes I don't
answers.1: poor — I spiral and stay down

questions.text: My ability to distinguish conviction from condemnation is ...

answers.4: good — I can usually tell whether it's from God or not
answers.5: sharp — I recognize the difference clearly and respond accordingly
answers.2: basic — I know they're different but can't always tell which is which
answers.3: developing — I sometimes discern correctly, sometimes confuse them
answers.1: poor — it all feels the same

questions.text: My practical techniques for fighting specific temptations are ...
questions.principle: Tactical skill comes from tested experience

answers.4: tested — I have approaches that work for my specific struggles
answers.5: refined — I've developed personalized tactics that are highly effective
answers.2: generic — I know the standard advice but it doesn't work for me
answers.3: developing — some tactics work, others don't
answers.1: nonexistent — I just try to resist and usually fail
